name: Ivern

sources.import_notes: Generated baseline canonical champion file from From Online dataset.

notes: Ability effects are intentionally minimal placeholders until scripted modeling is added.

passive.name: Friend of the Forest
passive.description:
Freeing the  Krug camp will only grant the  gold and  experience of 1  Ancient Krug, 2  Krugs, and 3  Mini Krugs.
Ivern must be within  275 units of the large monster of the targeted camp to start channeling or collect a grove. The large monsters also must be  visible.
If Ivern cannot afford the cost to place a grove, Friend of the Forest is placed on a cooldown equal to the number of seconds it takes for his  health regeneration and/or  mana regeneration to restore him to the amount of health and/or mana needed to afford the cost.
The cooldown will update based on Ivern's current health and mana regeneration, as well as his current health and mana.
Friend of the Forest can be used while Ivern or the camp is in combat and, once the grove is placed,  Smite can be used to instantly claim the camp.  Interrupting Ivern's channel is the only way to contest jungle camps, short of killing the camp during the channel time.
Freeing a grove causes the monsters within the camp to be dealt 5000 true damage in the  internalraw damage source type by Ivern, despite his inability to damage them.
Friend of the Forest will leave Ivern at 1 health if cast with exactly the required amount. Friend of the Forest cannot be cast with less, unlike other abilities with health costs.
Non-epic monsters can attack Ivern if his allies enter combat with the monster and he manages to recieve aggro.(bug)
Ivern can be attacked by  Voidmites without being able to damage them back.(note)
The following table refers for interactions while Ivern is  channeling:
Ivern is unable to act during the first 0.15 and last 0.5 seconds of the channel.

basic_ability_1.name: Rootcaller
basic_ability_1.description: Active:  Ivern throws a vine in the target direction that deals magic damage and  roots the first enemy hit.
basic_ability_1.description_source:
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the start of the cast time.
 Daisy dashes to rooted  monsters, and enemy champions if within 1200 units when Rootcaller hits.
She does not dash to enemy minions.(note)
 Daisy can not dash if she's more than 1200 units from the target hit. She will not dash even if she later walks in range.(bug)
Regardless of  Daisy's and Ivern's distance from the target hit, Ivern dashing does not affect  Daisy in any way.(bug)
Rootcaller will hit  monsters but does not deal damage to it unless the target is an epic monster.
Ivern's pull/attack range is determined when he dashes to the target - not from when he initially casts Rootcaller and throws the vine.
Ivern can rightclick on the target hit to dash to it, stopping at his attack range.
Rightclicking while closer than attack range to the target makes Ivern dash to 425 units away from it.
This interacts like expected with attack range increases, increasing the dash distance away from the target 1:1.
Ivern will never dash closer than his current distance from the target when rightclicking within attack range.
Recasting dashes Ivern to on top of the enemy instead of at attack range.
Ivern and his allies are not able to dash to the target unless they are within 1200 units.
Rootcaller cannot be used to  dash while  grounded or  rooted. This applies to Ivern and his allies.
Rootcaller's dash does not follow targets, their position at the time of starting the dash is the location Ivern and his allies will stop from.

basic_ability_2.name: Brushmaker
basic_ability_2.description: Passive: While  Ivern is in  brush, his basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.
basic_ability_2.description_source:
A  brush will be immediately  exposed if grown within the  sight of an enemy  turret.
The bonus damage does not apply to structures.
The bonus damage won't trigger through  block,  dodge, or  blinding effects.
The empowerment given to allies respects  enchantment redirection.
Epic monsters can not be concealed within, or behind a  brush.
Both  Voidgrubs and  Atakhan can be concealed within, and behind a  brush(bug).
 Brushmaker locks on allies when hovered.
The indicator for Brushmaker's cast range has a radius of 1150, which is significantly higher than its actual cast range.(bug)

basic_ability_3.name: Triggerseed
basic_ability_3.description: Active:  Ivern can target an ally champion,  Daisy, or himself to  shield them for a short time.
basic_ability_3.description_source:
The explosion occurs regardless of whether the shield is maintained.
The damage of Triggerseed is attributed to the champion the shield was cast on.
If cast on  Daisy, the damage is attributed to Ivern.
The  slow debuff is always attributed to Ivern.
Therefore, placing Triggerseed on allied champions:
grants them credit for all kills on enemy units that it causes.
triggers turret aggro on them if it deals damage to an enemy champion.
triggers their spell effects instead of Ivern's.
benefits from their  magic penetration stat.
Ivern's player can appreciate the damage Triggerseed from an ally deals via a yellow damage number intended to reflect the damage dealt.
This yellow damage number uses Ivern's  magic penetration stat to calculate the expected damage dealt, instead of reflecting the actual damage dealt.(bug)

ultimate.name: Daisy!
ultimate.description: Active:  Ivern summons his Sentinel friend  Daisy to fight with him.
ultimate.description_source:
Only the initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as  Spellblade.
Recasting the ability does, however, count as casting an ultimate ability for the purposes of  Experimental Hexplate's Overdrive and similar effects.(bug)
PENDING FOR TEST: What about  Force Pulse's?
Daisy, when the ability is initially cast, is  untargetable until she lands.
Recasting Daisy! does not interrupt  Recall's channel.
